Title:
A new lichenized fungus, Orientophila corticola, from South
Korea, with a key to the genus
Abstract:
Orientophila corticola is described as a new lichenized
fungus from South Korea. The new species is distinguishable from other
Orientophila species by the substrate preference to tree barks and the
habitat specificity to inland areas. Molecular analyses applying ITS and
mtSSU sequences clearly classify O. corticola as a distinct species in
the genus Orientophila. A surrogate key is provided to assist in the
identification of all 13 taxa in the genus Orientophila.
